title: How to Mount a Windows Share on an Ubuntu Server

steps.headline: Install samba file system utilities.
steps.description:
sudo apt-get install smbfs (In new version install sudo apt-get install cifs-utils){"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e7\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/e7\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":291,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"461","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>

\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Create a directory to use as the mount point.
steps.description:
sudo mkdir /mnt/backup{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9b\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/9\/9b\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":293,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"463","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Edit the file system table to include the new mount point.
steps.description:
sudo vi /etc/fstab{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":295,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"467","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Append the following snippet to the end of the file.
steps.description:
Scroll to the end and press a to append text. Note that the text should all be on one line. //YOUR_SERVER/YOUR_SHARE /mnt/backup cifs domain=YOUR_DOMAIN,username=YOUR_USERNAME,password=YOUR_PASSWORD 0 0{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/60\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/6\/60\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":296,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"469","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Save and exit.
steps.description:
To exit vi you leave edit mode by pressing escape. Then enter command mode by typing colon. Then enter wq to write and quit. Type :wq{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":293,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"463","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Reload the fstab file to mount the share.
steps.description:
sudo mount -a{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":292,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"462","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>

\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Check the mount was successful by listing the contents of the share.
steps.description:
ls /mnt/backup{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bd\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/bd\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":296,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"468","licensing":"

text:
Install samba file system utilities. sudo apt-get install smbfs (In new version install sudo apt-get install cifs-utils){"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e7/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/e/e7/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":291,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"461","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Create a directory to use as the mount point. sudo mkdir /mnt/backup{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9b/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/9/9b/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":293,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"463","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Edit the file system table to include the new mount point. sudo vi /etc/fstab{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/b8/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":295,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"467","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Append the following snippet to the end of the file. Scroll to the end and press a to append text. Note that the text should all be on one line. //YOUR_SERVER/YOUR_SHARE /mnt/backup cifs domain=YOUR_DOMAIN,username=YOUR_USERNAME,password=YOUR_PASSWORD 0 0{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/60/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":296,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"469","licensing":"

"} Save and exit. To exit vi you leave edit mode by pressing escape. Then enter command mode by typing colon. Then enter wq to write and quit. Type :wq{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/5/5e/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":293,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"463","licensing":"

"} Reload the fstab file to mount the share. sudo mount -a{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/e/eb/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":292,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"462","licensing":"

"} Check the mount was successful by listing the contents of the share. ls /mnt/backup{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/bd/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":296,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"468","licensing":"

sentences:
sudo apt-get install smbfs (In new version install sudo apt-get install cifs-utils){"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e7\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/e7\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":291,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"461","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Create a directory to use as the mount point.

sudo mkdir /mnt/backup{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9b\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/9\/9b\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":293,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"463","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Edit the file system table to include the new mount point.

sudo vi /etc/fstab{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":295,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"467","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Append the following snippet to the end of the file.
Scroll to the end and press a to append text.
Note that the text should all be on one line.

//YOUR_SERVER/YOUR_SHARE /mnt/backup cifs domain=YOUR_DOMAIN,username=YOUR_USERNAME,password=YOUR_PASSWORD 0 0{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/60\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/6\/60\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":296,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"469","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Save and exit.
To exit vi you leave edit mode by pressing escape.
Then enter command mode by typing colon.
Then enter wq to write and quit.

Type :wq{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":293,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"463","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Reload the fstab file to mount the share.

sudo mount -a{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":292,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"462","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Check the mount was successful by listing the contents of the share.

ls /mnt/backup{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bd\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/bd\/Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/aid1129016-v4-728px-Mount-a-Windows-Share-on-an-Ubuntu-Server-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":296,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"468","licensing":"
